line_items.specifications: Demolish HRV, ductwork and all associated appurtenances.

line_items.description: Outside air intakes, roof vents, and relief hoods
line_items.specifications: Demolish outside air intakes, roof vents and roof relief hoods as necessary. Verify size and configuration prior to ordering new vents.
line_items.notes: This is a general demolition note for various small rooftop penetrations.

line_items.description: Temporary removal and reinstallation of rooftop equipment
line_items.specifications: Coordinate the temporary removal of Mech, Elec or Comm equipment. Reinstall with new roofing on rubber walking pads.
line_items.notes: This is a critical coordination item for equipment not in contract (N.I.C.) but that must be moved to perform the roofing work.

line_items.specifications: 4" SCH40 ABS monitoring pipe. Connect to CPEP with Fernco Qwikseal.
Install new 1/2" plywood sheathing on parapet framing.
line_items.notes: Part of the parapet rebuild scope.
Part of the parapet rebuild scope.

line_items.specifications: 1200 CFM, 0.5" SP. Basis of Design: Greenheck CUBE-160-4.

gaps_identified: The condition of the existing plywood roof deck under the built-up roofing is unknown. An allowance for potential rot repair or replacement should be considered, as this is a common unforeseen condition in re-roofing projects.

ai_observations.title: Critical Scope Addition in Addendum No. 2 (Recovery Board)
ai_observations.insight: Addendum No. 2 mandates the installation of a 5/8" Georgia Pacific Dens Deck recovery board over all roof areas designated as R1. This is a requirement to achieve the specified 20-year/120mph warranty. This scope is not shown on the original architectural details (A2.3) for roof type R1 and represents a significant material and labor cost that could be easily missed if only reviewing the primary drawing set.
suggested_actions: Ensure the cost for the 5/8" recovery board is included in the Division 07 roofing estimate.
Verify the total square footage of all R1 roof areas from the plans to accurately quantify the recovery board.
Confirm attachment method of the new EPDM system over the recovery board complies with manufacturer and warranty requirements.

ai_observations.title: Extensive & Risky Electrical Modifications
ai_observations.insight: The electrical scope involves significant modifications with high potential for unforeseen costs. 1) Addendum No. 1 confirms that new RTU electrical loads exceed the original design basis, likely requiring upsized breakers and conductors not shown on the E-sheets. 2) The scope includes demolishing Panel 'X', adding new Panels 'D' and 'MECH', replacing a main breaker, and replacing a feeder. The feasibility and full cost of re-routing existing circuits and fitting new equipment into existing spaces needs to be field verified.
suggested_actions: The electrical estimator must account for upsizing circuits for all new RTUs based on the Addendum 1 mechanical submittal review.
Schedule a site visit to assess the main electrical room, panel locations, and existing circuit conditions to validate the feasibility of the planned modifications.
Carry a contingency for unforeseen electrical conditions, such as difficulty pulling new feeders or terminating old circuits.

ai_observations.title: Rooftop Equipment Coordination & Sequencing
ai_observations.insight: The project involves demolishing and replacing at least 6 RTUs and multiple exhaust fans. This requires tight coordination between Demolition (02), Roofing (07), Mechanical (23), and Electrical (26) trades. Sequencing is critical to maintain a watertight building envelope. New roof curbs must be installed and flashed by the roofer before the mechanical contractor can set the new units, which must be done before the electrical contractor can make final connections.
suggested_actions: Develop a detailed phasing and sequencing plan for the replacement of each RTU.
Hold pre-installation meetings with all affected trades to coordinate curb locations, sizes, and timelines.
Verify existing duct, pipe, and electrical locations and sizes prior to ordering new equipment, as Addendum 1 allows for substitutions which may have different connection points.

ai_observations.title: Additive Alternates Pricing Structure
ai_observations.insight: The demolition and replacement of RTU-1 and RTU-6 are defined as Additive Alternates #1 and #2, respectively. All associated work (demolition, new unit, curb, roofing, mechanical, and electrical) for these two units must be priced separately from the base bid. This is confirmed on the Bid Form (page 17 of the bid package).
suggested_actions: Create separate cost breakdowns for Additive Alternate #1 (RTU-1) and Additive Alternate #2 (RTU-6).
Ensure all trades provide separate pricing for their scope related to these two alternates.
Clearly state the alternate pricing on the bid form as required.

ai_observations.title: HVAC Controls Scope Clarification
ai_observations.insight: Addendum No. 1 clarifies the HVAC controls scope. It explicitly states to disregard mentions of a sequence of operations and DDC system. All new equipment is to be controlled by factory controls, wall-mounted timer switches, or a time clock. This significantly reduces the complexity and cost of the controls scope.
suggested_actions: Price controls based on factory-provided options and simple timers/time clocks.
Exclude costs for a building automation system (BAS/DDC) and complex programming.
Confirm with the mechanical subcontractor that they have seen and understood this clarification from Addendum 1.

ai_observations.title: Project Constraints: Occupied Facility & Strict Closeout
ai_observations.insight: The project will be performed in an occupied facility, which requires careful planning for safety, noise, dust control, and access. Additionally, the specifications (Sec 01 72 00) contain unusually strict requirements for maintaining daily 'As-Built' record documents, with the explicit threat of withholding progress payments for non-compliance. Section 01 67 00 also requires extensive owner training (8 hours per major system).
suggested_actions: Include costs in General Conditions for site protection, daily cleanup, and potential off-hours work to minimize disruption.
Assign a dedicated person to be responsible for daily updates to the record documents to ensure payments are not delayed.
Allocate sufficient time and resources in the project schedule and budget for the required owner training sessions.

overall_assessment.summary: The extraction covers the project scope well, but the project itself carries high risk. The most critical risk is a major scope addition (roof recovery board) detailed only in an addendum, which could easily be missed. A second major risk is the confirmed electrical load discrepancy for new HVAC units, also found in an addendum, which will likely require upsizing electrical infrastructure beyond what is shown on the base drawings. These addendum-driven changes, combined with significant electrical modifications in an existing building and complex rooftop sequencing, require careful review and pricing to avoid a significant bid error.
